pages.text: As of Geolosys v5 for Minecraft 1.16.4, Geolosys has moved almost entirely to the DataPack system. You can make a datapack to create, overwrite or flat-out remove existing Plutons, and this means there's built-in CraftTweaker compatibility! You can still use the (now deprecated) configurator found $(l:https://config.geolosys.com)here$(/l), but in general you should use Data Packs where possible.

Geolosys comes with a datapack built-in set of ores in its own data pack, organized as such:$(br)$(li)deposits/ores/<ore>$(li)deposits/stones/<stone>$(li)deposits/other/peat (and others)$(br)If you want to prevent any pre-configured ore, just overwrite the file with the exact path and name. You can find the built-in datapack $(l:https://github.com/oitsjustjose/Geolosys/tree/1.16/src/main/resources/data/geolosys/deposits)here$(/l)!
